channel.title: RSPS Webclient
channel.description: Hello. I have been trying for about 2 weeks now to turn my client/source into a webclient. I JAR my client and it doesn't load the cache from the desktop, and the HTML won't load at all, i get the error "ClassNotFoundException" and underneath it says "client.class". I don't know what else to do. I've tried tut after tut after tut trying all the different things a various amount of people have told others to try. Nothing is working. I don't know what to do. Someone help me please...

item.title: RSPS Webclient
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:7, topic:494769”][quote author=Lordabyssal link=topic=613001.msg4238389#msg4238389 date=1361690783]
Have you signed your client. Make sure you cache is in right dir.

Is your manifest correct. Sometimes its Gui.class or EGUI.class that starts the client.
[/quote]
If it’s a 317, it most likely client.java for the main class, not GUI or EGUI.[/quote]
C’mon 3lv3n, you know it’s looking for .class not .java

But yes, this has absolutely nothing to do with the cache. You need it to find the correct main class. Higher revisions use different main classes. I believe 718+ uses loader or Loader (caps matters).

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS Webclient
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“Lordabyssal, post:2, topic:494769”]Have you signed your client. Make sure you cache is in right dir.

Is your manifest correct. Sometimes its Gui.class or EGUI.class that starts the client.[/quote]
If it’s a 317, it most likely client.java for the main class, not GUI or EGUI.

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS Webclient
item.dc:creator: @D3ad0n3 D3ad0n3
item.description:
@D3ad0n3 wrote:

I have signed the jar. I don’t know where to place my cache, i’ve tried the C drive i’ve tried online link and neither work i’ve even left it inside the client and it still didn’t work. I just tried making it Gui.class for the main class on JARmaker and i still got the ClassNotFoundException Gui.class error.

Read full topic

Have you jar signed the desktop client? or made a keystore file (Certificate)?
